author: Robert Wall
title: Gulfstream, Cessna, Other Business Jet Makers Are Finally Feeling Some Lift
text:
Private-jet makers and operators are showing signs of recovering from a decadelong slump in the industry.
The 2008 financial crisis hobbled demand for private aircraft, and corporate caution and cost cutting since then have kept a lid on the market. Now, rising corporate profits, a demand-boosting incentive in the U.S. tax overhaul and a strong economic recovery in Europe are lifting the industryâ€™s prospects. And a weaker dollar is now making American-made aircraft cheaper overseas, attracting buyers.
